text: hena prabhu kothā gelā āchārya ṭhākura
translation: Where has Advaita Āchārya, the Lord who mercifully brought the wealth of divine love to this world, gone?

text: kā̐hā mora svarūpa rūpa kā̐hā sanātana
translation: Where are my Svarūp, Rūpa, and Sanātan? Where is my Raghunāth Dās? Where are the saviours of the fallen souls?
Where are my Raghunāth Bhaṭṭa and Gopāl Bhaṭṭa? Where is my Kṛṣṇadās Kavirāj? Where has the great dancer Śrī Gaurāṅga suddenly gone?

text: gaurāṅga guṇera nidhi kothā gele pāba
translation: I will break my head on a rock, I will enter into fire—where shall I go to reach the reservoir of all qualities, Śrī Gaurāṅga?

text: se saba saṅgīra saṅge ye kaila vilāsa
se saṅga nā pāñā kānde narottama dāsa
translation: Not finding the association of Śrī Gaurāṅga, who performed His Pastimes with all these associates, Narottam Dās weeps.
